cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles SW of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across Hispaniola and Cuba, then forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico and turn northwest toward the Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central or southeastern Louisiana coast (near the lower Mississippi River delta)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches confined to the Bahamas and parts of Cuba at this time – none along the U.S. Gulf Coast yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings only in Puerto Rico, Hispaniola and eastern Cuba at this time – none along the U.S. Gulf Coast yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Texas to Alabama likely to be affected, with highest risk focused on Louisiana coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) possible by late Tuesday night or Wednesday with a 34 % overall chance and 17 % peak onset probability.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests several feet of surge possible along the lower Mississippi River delta and adjacent bays at landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts, which could trigger flash and river flooding along the Mississippi River corridor.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Short-fused tornadoes in outer rainbands and extended river flooding on the lower Mississippi are possible and may disrupt port operations.
